column4: i did this as far as i can remember or something like it....   $  sudo mkdir /dev/dir/sdb1
or something like it then i used...........
but i DID mount my external... but the problem is this... i rebooted and now... its unmounted!!! all that work looking on the net did me NO good... is their a way to auto mount ?
Have people already given you fstab information?
like i said im new to linux i have NO clue what fstab is...
Did you ever get your hard drive worked out?
yeah i did, but i screwed it up agian and yeah...
Oi vei!! What did you do now??? :p

well i been having this on on going battle with virtualbox... and it yeah... well long story short, i can NEVER get virtualbox to work and this last time it screwed something up i have no idead how or what and i had to re-install ubuntu (giving me horriable flash backs of MS Windows) and now my drives wont mount agian...
Unfortunately, my Virtualbox experience is pretty minimal, not sure I'll be of much help.
do you know how to mount USB Drives ? and have them auto mount ?
i have the awesome conversation, and still do on how to do that, but it is on a USB drive i cannot mount so it is doing me ABSOLUTLY no good LOL!!!
without virtualbox  i gave up on it...
i get goose bumps with i hear the word virtualbox now
virtualbox is the devil in computer application form...
Well, again, if devices (especially flash drives), don't automount when you plug them in, something is fairly amiss.
